quotes.message: Flattery makes friends and truth makes enemies.
quotes.name: Spanish Proverb

quotes.message: Look closely at those who patronize you. Half are unfeeling, half untaught.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: Flattery is like chewing gum. Enjoy it but don't swallow it.
quotes.name: Hank Ketcham

quotes.message: A little flattery will support a man through great fatigue.
quotes.name: James Monroe

quotes.message: Flattery corrupts both the receiver and the giver.
quotes.name: Edmund Burke

quotes.message: Flattery succeeds best on minds previously occupied by conceit.
quotes.name: Norman Macdonald

quotes.message: Although a skillful flatterer is a most delightful companion if you have him all to yourself, his taste becomes very doubtful when he takes to complimenting other people.
quotes.name: Charles Dickens

quotes.message: Flattery is refined deception--it is the froth of language--it is the alcohol of social intercourse--it is the prescription of the subtle--and the nectar of fools.
quotes.name: William Scott Downey

quotes.message: Flattery is like cologne water, to be smelt, not swallowed
quotes.name: Josh Billings

quotes.message: Flattery is all right if you don't inhale.
quotes.name: Adlai Stevenson I

quotes.message: A fool flatters himself, a wise man flatters the fool.
quotes.name: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quotes.message: Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery.
quotes.name: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quotes.message: I pay no attention whatever to anybody's praise or blame. I simply follow my own feelings.
quotes.name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

quotes.message: The public wants work which flatters its illusions.
quotes.name: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.message: It is possible to be below flattery as well as above it.
quotes.name: Thomas B. Macaulay

quotes.message: A compliment is a statement of an agreeable truth; flattery is a statement of an agreeable untruth.
quotes.name: Sir John A. MacDonald

quotes.message: Between flattery and admiration there often flows a river of contempt.
quotes.name: Minna Antrim

quotes.message: Flattery is never so agreeable as to our blind side; commend a fool for his wit, or a knave for his honesty, and they will receive you into their bosoms.
quotes.name: Henry Fielding

quotes.message: There is no effect more disproportionate to its cause than the happiness bestowed by a small compliment.
quotes.name: Robert Brault

quotes.message: Some folks pay a compliment like they went down in their pocket for it.
quotes.name: Kin Hubbard

quotes.message: Like pollen on a honeybee, flattery clings to the things you tell yourself.
quotes.name: Willis Goth Regier

quotes.message: Flattery is a form of hatred.
quotes.name: Bible

quotes.message: He who says he hates every kind of flattery, and says it in earnest, certainly does not yet know every kind of flattery.
quotes.name: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quotes.message: I cannot think of any character below the flatterer, except he who envies him.
quotes.name: Sir Richard Steele

quotes.message: Do not offer a compliment and ask a favor at the same time. A compliment that is charged for is not valuable.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: The voice of flattery affects us after it has ceased, just as after a concert men find some agreeable air ringing in their ears to the exclusion of all serious business.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Here comes Glib-tongue: who can out-flatter a Dedication; and lie, like ten Epitaphs.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Flattery is like friendship in show, but not in fruit
quotes.name: Socrates

quotes.message: Flattery is telling the other person precisely what he thinks about himself
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: Sweet words are like honey, a little may refresh, but too much gluts the stomach.
quotes.name: Anne Bradstreet

quotes.message: None are more taken in by flattery than the proud, who wish to be the first and are not.
quotes.name: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.message: Some indeed there are who profess to despise all flattery, but even these are nevertheless to be flattered, by being told that they do despise it.
quotes.name: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.message: Popular culture is a place where pity is called compassion, flattery is called love, propaganda is called knowledge, tension is called peace, gossip is called news, and auto-tune is called singing.
quotes.name: Criss Jami

quotes.message: The aim of flattery is to soothe and encourage us by assuring us of the truth of an opinion we have already formed about ourselves.
quotes.name: Edith Sitwell

quotes.message: Flattery is no more than what raises in a man's mind an idea of a preference which he has not.
quotes.name: Edmund Burke

quotes.message: Flattery is a counterfeit money which, but for vanity, would have no circulation.
quotes.name: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.message: If we did not flatter ourselves, the flattery of others could never harm us.
quotes.name: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.message: Baloney is flattery laid on so thick it cannot be true, and blarney is flattery so thin we love it.
quotes.name: Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.message: No man flatters the woman he truly loves.
quotes.name: Henry Theodore Tuckerman

quotes.message: Flattery is the worst and falsest way of showing our esteem.
quotes.name: Jonathan Swift

quotes.message: The flattery of posterity is not worth much more than contemporary flattery, which is worth nothing.
quotes.name: Jorge Luis Borges

quotes.message: The most skillful flattery is to let a person talk on, and be a listener.
quotes.name: Joseph Addison

quotes.message: Listening, not imitation, may be the sincerest form of flattery.
quotes.name: Joyce Brothers

quotes.message: In the best, the friendliest and simplest relations flattery or praise is necessary, just as grease is necessary to keep wheels turning.
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: We despise no source that can pay us a pleasing attention.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Flattery pleases very generally. In the first place, the flatterer may think what he says to be true; but, in the second place, whether he thinks so or not, he certainly thinks those whom he flatters of consequence enough to be flattered.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: No visor does become black villainy so well as soft and tender flattery.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare
